content.raw: Hmm I can't find the screenshots or even know whether anything got captured. Some user feedback about if and where a screenshot got saved would be useful (similar to VLC's screenshot function).
content.html: Hmm I can't find the screenshots or even know whether anything got captured. Some user feedback about if and where a screenshot got saved would be useful (similar to VLC's screenshot function).

content.raw: ok I'll update this pull request later to save the screenshot on the client side and provide some user feedback
content.html: ok I'll update this pull request later to save the screenshot on the client side and provide some user feedback

content.raw: I'd suggest a default location to be `~/.gazebo/pictures` or something similar.
content.html: I'd suggest a default location to be ~/.gazebo/pictures or something similar.

content.raw: ``~/Pictures`` or ``~/Pictures/Gazebo`` might be more comfortable ... otherwise you need to access a hidden folder to get them.
content.html: ~/Pictures or ~/Pictures/Gazebo might be more comfortable ... otherwise you need to access a hidden folder to get them.

content.raw: right now I place them in ~/.gazebo/pictures where all other gazebo files are, maybe in the future we'll add a feature to allow users to configure save locations. Thanks for the feedback
content.html: right now I place them in ~/.gazebo/pictures where all other gazebo files are, maybe in the future we'll add a feature to allow users to configure save locations. Thanks for the feedback

content.raw: It's possible to save frames from a camera sensor via a parameter in SDF. It may not be appropriate to add "_screenshot" to these images as well.
content.html: It's possible to save frames from a camera sensor via a parameter in SDF. It may not be appropriate to add "_screenshot" to these images as well.
